item.title: Wifi
item.description: Was unable to capture traffic for my wifi using airport sniff . It turns out my wifi is on channel 44 and not 1. airport sniff 44 # works Beacon frame - wlan.fc.type_subtype != 0x08 && wlan.ssid == "Waves in Space-5G" && wlan.ta == e4:76:84:ce:61:0d

item.title: Impl Sha256
item.description: How does SHA256 work? What is a hash? Given a messages M of m bits generate a data N of n bits where n < m. Must be collision resistant What is cryptographic hash? h = H(x) Large input domain -> small fixed output => compression Well distributed P(H(x)-i) = 1/N Three additional properties: Pre-image resistant - given H(x), hard to find x. Weak collision resistance - hard to find any x such that H(x) = h Strong collision resistance - hard to find any pair such that H(x) = H(y) How is hashing different from encryption?

item.title: Breaking the Resolution
item.description: Two machines on the internet can talk to each other iff both of them know each other’s IP addresses. When we type in “google.com” in the browser, the first task of the browser is to get the IP address of “google.com” which it does by communicating with the DNS system. Once an IP address is received, the browser establishes a TCP connection to the server, does a TLS handshake, exchanges data with the server before terminating the connection.

item.title: Dnssec
item.description: Prelude Is DNS secure without DNSSEC??? No. All queries made by clients to recursive resolver, authoritative name servers, TLD name servers or root name servers are un-encrypted. Apart from that DNS is based on UDP protocol which is connectionless in nature such that if i have a DNS server running on my (public) machine anyone who knows the IP and port on which the server is listening for traffic, can easily send request to it.

Hi, I’m Karan Chaudhary. My interests span from designing and debugging distributed systems to improving developer productivity. Currently I’m a Senior Software Engineer in Demonware. My previous gigs were at Amazon, Fresworks and a triple of startups. You can reach out to me here: fghjklp at the rate gmail dot com. Thanks, Karan
